node.title: Auckland charity calls on Govt to provide more culturally-appropriate help to struggling families
node.description: The charity said often families get food they do not normally eat, including Muslims getting non-halal food.
node.content: ["An Auckland-based charity group says the government needs to provide more culturally-appropriate help for struggling families.", "Wellbeing Charitable Trust provides mental health and family violence support to ethnic groups and has also been helping families with food parcels during the pandemic.", "Co-founder Eva Chen said the charity itself does not have direct funding from the government for food parcels, so they often have to refer people to bigger organisations.", "She said often families get food they do not normally eat, including Muslims getting non halal food.", "Chen said contents for food parcels should be culturally-appropriate.", "Organisations should not stigmatise people, by avoiding asking them for detailed personal information, she said.", "Chen said need is increasing under the Red traffic light setting and officials should heed the call.", "RNZ"]
